label.intro:
Aims:

Introduction to agroecological principles: how research methods can better meet today's agricultural needs. Considering interactions of factors and the need for multidimensional studies.

Introduction to qualitative methods through a practical course evaluation: design and data collection.

Topics to cover:

A data science study: from design to report, a guided analysis of the Millet game

8.3 Visualising Interactions

Agroecology and systems thinking

9.1 Options by Context

9.2 Multidimensionality

A Qualitative component: From design to report, course evaluation

10.1 Qualitative research methods
